Subject: New Paper on a Compiler for CPPNs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=KnPvxPlvOOw3JG7usMw7XmerZeQWvGQnzwZAjyqMb7dKjzYmI7FEdN4

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

Hello all,

I'm happy to announce my new AAAI symposium paper on a compiler for CPPNs
that allows to automatically transform phenotypic descriptions Into
genotypic representations:

PDF: http://www.cs.ucf.edu/~risi/risi_aaai2013.pdf

In this paper, the CPPN-Compiler is able to generate CPPN-encoded
representations from vector-based images that can serve as the starting
point for further evolution. Importantly, the offspring of these compiled
CPPNs show meaningful variations because they directly embody important
domain-specific regularities like symmetry or repetition. The CPPN-Compiler
tries to solve a similar problem than Clune in his paper on the seeded-CPPN
technique. However, the CPPN-Compiler does not require an external scaffold
that evolution can elaborate on and the resulting phenotypic regularities
are directly embodied in the CPPN.

In the future it will be interesting to extend this concept to the wide
variety of CPPN-enabled domains. For example, a CPPN-Compiler could also
automatically generate seeds for ANNs created by HyperNEAT. Such a neural
CPPN-Compiler could automatically construct CPPNs that produce structural
organization we see in natural brains (e.g. the organization of the
cortical columns), potentially allowing higher cognitive tasks to be solved.

We are also working on an interactive webpage, where you will be able to
specify shapes by hand and then start interactive evolution from the
compiled seed. I will make another announcement once it is usable.

I hope you enjoy the paper and am looking forward to your thoughts.

Best,
Sebastian


--
Dr. Sebastian Risi
Assistant Professor
IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D08
Rued Langgaards Vej 7, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
email: sebastian.risi@..., web: http://www.cs.ucf.edu/~risi/
mobile: +45-50250355, office: +45-7218-5127
